text.$t: Carbohydrate metabolism; tricarboxylic acid cycle; isocitrate from oxaloacetate: step 1/2.
Citrate synthase is found in nearly all cells capable of oxidative metabolism.
Belongs to the citrate synthase family.

title.$t: Extensive mosaic structure revealed by the complete genome sequence of uropathogenic Escherichia coli.

feature.@description: In Ref. 1; AAA23892 and 6; AA sequence.

title.$t: Complete sequence of the gltA gene encoding citrate synthase in Escherichia coli.
A 718-kb DNA sequence of the Escherichia coli K-12 genome corresponding to the 12.7-28.0 min region on the linkage map.
The complete genome sequence of Escherichia coli K-12.
Highly accurate genome sequences of Escherichia coli K-12 strains MG1655 and W3110.
Nucleotide sequence encoding the flavoprotein and hydrophobic subunits of the succinate dehydrogenase of Escherichia coli.
Amino acid sequence of Escherichia coli citrate synthase.
Nucleotide sequence of the promoter region of the citrate synthase gene (gltA) of Escherichia coli.
Transcript analysis of the citrate synthase and succinate dehydrogenase genes of Escherichia coli K12.
The synthesis and use of oligodeoxynucleotides in plasmid DNA sequencing.
The role of cysteine 206 in allosteric inhibition of Escherichia coli citrate synthase. Studies by chemical modification, site-directed mutagenesis, and 19F NMR.
Lysine acetylation is a highly abundant and evolutionarily conserved modification in Escherichia coli.
